prompt.preamble:
We are testing a system for understanding people's fuzzy intuitions and preferences.
In this experiment, we'll be capturing your moral intuitions about the act of stealing a loaf of bread, and whether there are certain cases where stealing may be morally permissible.
prompt.task_description: your belief of when it is moral to steal a loaf of bread
prompt.final: In the final part of the study, you will give feedback on a test set of moral situations, which will enable us to see how well a chatbot reading your responses has learned your moral preferences.
prompt.evaluation: Please indicate whether you think the following situations are morally permissible or not: "yes" if they are, "no" if they aren't.

conversation_history.message: Situation: Is it ethical to steal a loaf of bread to feed your starving children, knowing the bread is from a struggling small business whose owner is also barely making ends meet?
I don't think it the best of ideas but I needed to save my kids life as well

Situation: Is it ethical to steal a loaf of bread from a wealthy individual who wouldn't notice the loss, while you're not starving but simply cannot afford to buy it due to your financial circumstances?
Yes it is cos I don't have the privilege to be as wealthy as them.

Situation: Is it ethical to steal a loaf of bread from a supermarket chain that has a policy of throwing away unsold food items at the end of the day, when you are not starving, but you intend to give it to a homeless person who is hungry?
No its not wrong or a bad move since the homeless needs it more to survive and disposing it is wrong

Situation: Is it ethical to steal a loaf of bread from a bakery after a natural disaster, where resources are scarce for everyone, and you have the ability to pay but no one is available to accept your payment?
I don't have anyone to pay to and that's not a problem for me

Situation: Is it ethical to steal a loaf of bread from a supermarket chain that is known for exploiting its workers and ignoring environmental regulations, when you can afford to buy it but don't agree with the company's practices and want to protest against them?
Yes I will do that without any hesitation cos of how they treat their workers.

Situation: Is it ethical to steal a loaf of bread from a neighbor who has plenty, when you're not starving, but you're saving up for an important medical procedure that you can't afford due to high medical costs?
No it is not but I need to save my life and get my medical cost covered.

query_prompt.content:
Your task is to learn under what conditions the user would believe it is or is not ethical to steal a loaf of bread.

Come up with a potential edge case to learn as much information as you can about what their desired behavior should be under different circumstances.
Make sure the edge case addresses different aspects of the system than the edge cases that have already been considered.

An example edge case is: Situation: Is it ethical to steal a loaf of bread if you are starving to death and the bread would otherwise go to waste?

Current cases:
- [Q] -> [A]

Generate the most informative edge case that, when answered, will reveal the most about the desired behavior beyond what has already been queried for above. Generate the edge case in the following format, and nothing else: "Situation: [edge case]"
